DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To study acute chronic effect whole-body vibration ( WBV ) exercise low extremity blood flow , mobility function , balance , muscle strength , bone density , general health status , feasibility intervention frail elderly patient . Design : Randomized controlled trial . Subjects : The frail old person meet Fried Frailty Criteria . Interventions : All eligible subject randomly assign 4 group : ( 1 ) WBV group : Subjects receive whole-body vibration exercise alone ; ( 2 ) Progressive resistance training ( PRT ) group : Subjects receive progressive resistance training ; ( 3 ) WBV+ PRT group : Subjects receive whole-body vibration progressive resistance training ; ( 4 ) Control group : Subjects receive intervention/training . The period intervention 12 week . Main measure : The low extremity blood flow ( diameter red blood cell velocity common femoral artery ) , time go test , 30-second chair stand test , five time sit stand test , low extremity muscle strength , balance function , balance confidence , bone density , general health status assess begin study , instant , 12 week 24 month intervention . Study hypothesis : Whole-body vibration exercise safe effective method improve low extremity blood flow , mobility function , balance , muscle strength , bone density , general health status frail elderly .
DOC.criteria: ≥75 year old Fried Frailty Criteria Mini Mental State Examination score ≥18 Recent fracture ( ≤6 month ) Gallbladder kidney stone Malignancies Rheumatic arthritis Epilepsy Serious heart sicknesses implant , bypass stent cardiac pacemaker Any disease associated life expectancy le 12 month
